Sure, here are 7 sites in Buenos Aires with interesting stories behind them that could be included in a walking tour:

1. Plaza de Mayo - This iconic plaza is the site of many of Argentina's political demonstrations and has been the center of political life in Buenos Aires since the city's founding in the 16th century. It's also home to the Casa Rosada, the presidential palace where Evita Perón famously addressed the crowds.
2. Teatro Colón - This stunning opera house is considered one of the finest in the world and has hosted many of the world's greatest performers. It was opened in 1908 and has undergone several renovations and restorations since then.
3. Recoleta Cemetery - This famous cemetery is the final resting place of many of Argentina's most notable figures, including Eva Perón, former presidents, and Nobel Prize winners. The cemetery's elaborate mausoleums and monuments are a testament to the wealth and power of Argentina's elite.
4. Palacio Barolo - This unique building was designed by Italian architect Mario Palanti and completed in 1923. It was inspired by Dante's Divine Comedy and is said to represent the journey from Hell to Heaven. The building was once the tallest in Buenos Aires and has stunning views of the city.
5. Caminito - This colorful street in the neighborhood of La Boca is a popular tourist destination and a symbol of Buenos Aires. The buildings are brightly painted in different colors and it's a great place to see tango dancers and street performers.
6. San Telmo Market - This historic market is one of the oldest in Buenos Aires and has been operating since 1897. It's a great place to find antiques, handmade crafts, and traditional Argentine foods. On Sundays, there's also a popular flea market in the area.
7. Avenida de Mayo - This grand avenue is lined with beautiful buildings, cafes, and shops. It was designed to resemble the grand boulevards of Paris and was once the center of Buenos Aires' high society. It's a great place to stroll and take in the city's architecture and culture.
